[Home](./index.md) &gt; [@thi.ng/hdom](./hdom.md) &gt; [HDOMOpts](./hdom.hdomopts.md)

## HDOMOpts interface

<b>Signature:</b>

```typescript
export interface HDOMOpts 
```

## Properties

|  Property | Type | Description |
|  --- | --- | --- |
|  [autoDerefKeys](./hdom.hdomopts.autoderefkeys.md) | <code>PropertyKey[]</code> | Attempts to auto-expand/deref the given keys in the user supplied context object (<code>ctx</code> option) prior to \*each\* tree normalization. All of these values should implement the [IDeref](./api.ideref.md) interface (e.g. atoms, cursors, views, rstreams etc.). This feature can be used to define dynamic contexts linked to the main app state, e.g. using derived views provided by [@thi.ng/atom](./atom.md)<!-- -->. |
|  [ctx](./hdom.hdomopts.ctx.md) | <code>any</code> | Arbitrary user context object, passed to all component functions embedded in the tree. |
|  [hydrate](./hdom.hdomopts.hydrate.md) | <code>boolean</code> | If true, the first frame will only be used to inject event listeners, using the <code>hydrateDOM()</code> function.<!-- -->\*Important:\* Enabling this option assumes that an equivalent DOM (minus event listeners) already exists (e.g. generated via SSR / hiccup's <code>serialize()</code>) when hdom's <code>start()</code> function is called. Any other discrepancies between the pre-existing DOM and the hdom trees will cause undefined behavior. |
|  [keys](./hdom.hdomopts.keys.md) | <code>boolean</code> | If true, each elements will receive an auto-generated <code>key</code> attribute (unless one already exists). |
|  [root](./hdom.hdomopts.root.md) | <code>Element &#124; string</code> | Root element or ID |
|  [span](./hdom.hdomopts.span.md) | <code>boolean</code> | If true, all text content will be wrapped in <code>&lt;span&gt;</code> elements. Spans will never be created inside <option>, <textarea> or <text> elements. |
